meanings.definition: Without beginning or end; lasting forever.
meanings.sent1: The stars in the sky seem eternally bright, never fading away.
meanings.sent2: The ancient tree stood eternally tall, its roots deeply embedded in the earth.
meanings.sent3: The eternal flame in the town square never goes out, even during the heaviest rainstorms.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was like an eternally burning fire, never dimming or flickering.
meanings.sent5: The legend of the eternally sleeping princess captivated the hearts of all who heard it.

meanings.sent1: She promised to support him eternally, through thick and thin.
meanings.sent2: The lighthouse beacon shines eternally, guiding ships safely to shore.
meanings.sent3: He joked that his cat was eternally hungry, always meowing for more food.
meanings.sent4: The river flowed eternally, never pausing or stopping its journey to the sea.
meanings.sent5: The old clock in the tower ticked eternally, marking the passage of time with unwavering precision.
